heroIntro:
Welcome to your ideal family home in Aspe, a thriving town on the Costa Blanca where space, affordability, and community come together. This stunning 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers 188m² of contemporary living space set on an impressive 13,172m² plot—giving your family room to grow, play, and create lasting memories. At €442,000, this property represents exceptional value at €2,351/m², priced 40% below comparable villas on Spanish islands, making premium Costa Blanca living accessible for families seeking quality without the inflated coastal price tags.

Aspe welcomes families with open arms. This established community combines authentic Spanish charm with modern convenience, featuring excellent schools, safe neighborhoods, and easy access to healthcare. The generous plot means space for children to explore, gardens to cultivate, and room for future development. Whether you're seeking a permanent base or a smart investment property that generates rental income (typical weekly rates €800), this villa delivers on all fronts.

The property sits in Poligono 19, a strategic location offering the perfect balance: close enough to reach international schools and Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes, yet far enough removed to enjoy peaceful, spacious living. For families building their Spanish dream, this is where lifestyle meets investment potential.

The town enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with warm Mediterranean summers and mild winters—ideal for outdoor family activities year-round. Aspe's geography provides natural protection while maintaining excellent road connections to larger towns, beaches, and international amenities. The local economy is stable and diverse, attracting both Spanish nationals and international families who appreciate the town's genuine character, lower cost of living compared to coastal areas, and welcoming community atmosphere.
lifestyleSection: Life in Aspe revolves around family, community, and outdoor enjoyment. The town features a thriving expat community where English is commonly spoken, easing the transition for international families. Weekly markets overflow with fresh local produce, while major supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl offer familiar international brands. The social calendar is filled with local fiestas, cultural events, and family-friendly activities. Healthcare is accessible through private clinics with English-speaking doctors and a regional hospital just 30 minutes away. Schools in the region include international options with British curriculum, providing educational continuity for expat families. Weekend adventures are endless: Blue Flag beaches are 20 minutes away for seaside outings, championship golf courses dot the region for weekend recreation, and the nearby mountains offer hiking opportunities. Daily life balances Spanish traditions with modern convenience, creating an ideal environment where children can thrive in safe neighborhoods while families stay connected to international amenities.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment on the Costa Blanca. At €442,000, it's priced below Aspe's average (€2,200/m²), positioning you advantageously in a market growing at 8% year-on-year. The rental market is particularly attractive for families considering seasonal income: similar properties generate €800 weekly during peak season, delivering potential annual returns of €30,000-€35,000. Unlike expensive coastal properties, this villa offers realistic rental occupancy rates without the marketing challenges of oversaturated beachfront markets. The Aspe property market continues gaining recognition among smart buyers seeking value outside inflated island markets—typically 40% higher per square meter. For families planning extended periods in Spain or exploring semi-retirement, the combination of affordable purchase price, strong rental income potential, and genuine lifestyle benefits makes this villa a strategic acquisition.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment region. The area offers established expat communities, strong rental markets, rising property values (currently appreciating 8% annually), and exceptional quality of life combining Spanish culture with modern amenities. Property prices remain 30-40% lower than northern Spanish coastal markets, providing genuine value. Families particularly benefit from excellent schools, healthcare, and year-round outdoor lifestyle. The region's stability, infrastructure, and international population make it ideal for both personal enjoyment and investment returns.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions or requiring Spanish residency. UK nationals, EU citizens, and international buyers have equal purchase rights. The process involves opening a Spanish bank account, obtaining a tax identification number (NIE), and working with a qualified property lawyer and real estate agent. Most transactions complete within 6-8 weeks. Our team assists international buyers throughout the entire process, ensuring legal compliance and smooth transfers.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 10-12% in additional costs: property transfer tax (6-10%), legal fees (500-1,500€), notary fees (400-800€), and real estate agent commission (3-5%). Some buyers are exempt from transfer tax under specific circumstances. Once owned, annual costs include property tax (typically 0.4-1.1% of valuation), community fees if applicable (this villa has none), and optional private insurance. These costs remain significantly lower than UK equivalents, contributing to the strong financial case for Spanish property investment.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing (IBI - Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) average 0.4-1.1% of officially valued property price, varying by municipality. For this €442,000 villa in Aspe, expect approximately €1,500-2,000 annually, though exact amounts depend on municipal assessment. This remains considerably lower than UK council tax and property taxes. Capital gains tax applies when selling (typically 19-45% depending on ownership duration and residency status), but primary residence exemptions and long-term ownership reductions significantly reduce tax liability. A tax advisor can optimize your specific situation.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can secure mortgages in Spain through Spanish banks and international lenders. Most banks offer 60-80% loan-to-value financing for non-residents. Requirements typically include proof of income, employment verification, and a substantial deposit (20-40%). Interest rates remain competitive, especially for longer-term fixed-rate mortgages. International buyers often find Spanish mortgages more accessible than expected, particularly through banks experienced with expat clientele. UK nationals retain access to some specialized expat mortgages as well. Our network includes mortgage advisors specializing in international buyers.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to UK costs. Groceries, dining, and utilities typically cost 30-40% less than equivalent UK expenses. Restaurant meals range €12-20 for quality local dining; supermarket shopping reflects Mediterranean prices for fresh produce. Utilities (electricity, water, internet) run €80-150 monthly depending on season and usage. Healthcare costs are minimal with private insurance available from €50-100 monthly. Childcare and education fees remain reasonable for international schools. Overall, families report monthly living costs 25-35% lower than comparable UK standards—a significant factor in lifestyle and financial planning.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ sunshine days annually, making outdoor living feasible year-round. Summers (June-August) are warm (28-32°C) with low rainfall; winters mild (10-15°C) with occasional cold snaps but rarely freezing. Spring and autumn offer perfect temperatures (18-24°C) for outdoor activities. Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring with dry summers—ideal for families planning beach visits and outdoor exploration. The climate significantly reduces seasonal heating costs and enables year-round lifestyle activities impossible in many northern European locations.

faqs.question: Is this property suitable for families with children?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. This villa is specifically ideal for families. The 13,172m² plot provides ample space for children to play safely, explore nature, and develop outdoor activities without the constraints of typical suburban properties. Three separate bedrooms accommodate growing families or visiting relatives; three bathrooms eliminate morning scheduling conflicts. The Aspe location offers excellent international schools, safe neighborhoods, and welcoming expat community. Proximity to beaches (20 minutes) enables family recreation; established healthcare facilities provide medical peace of mind. The property combines modern living standards with spacious outdoor freedom—exactly what families seek when relocating to Spain.

faqs.question: What are the rental income possibilities for this villa?
faqs.answer: This villa generates strong rental potential, particularly attractive for families combining personal use with income generation. Similar 3-bedroom properties in the Aspe area command €800 per week during peak season (June-September), delivering €15,000-20,000 for a 5-month summer season. Shoulder seasons (April-May, September-October) attract €600-700 weekly. Even winter months generate €500+ weekly bookings, particularly during UK school holidays. Conservative annual rental income projections reach €25,000-30,000 with professional management, providing meaningful returns on investment while maintaining personal vacation flexibility. This property works equally well as primary residence, holiday home, or investment asset.
